definition: exhausting/hard/tough/arduous/to work hard/to go to a lot of trouble/hardship(s)

(of taste) hot or pungent/hard/laborious/suffering/eighth in order/eighth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/letter "H" or Roman "VIII" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 285°/octa
to have suffered all kinds of hardships (idiom)

sentences.english: The hardship of body and mind of man of A phoenix show solicitude for, more help him prostitute of outer call together.
sentences.chinese: 阿鳳體恤丈夫身心的辛苦，更幫助他在外召妓。

sentences.english: William rehearse played the pain, and the demand notice to take care of health.
sentences.chinese: 威廉排戲辛苦了，需要注意保重身體。

sentences.english: Ann: Hardship is one thing, the other thing is the conceptions and practices of child education.
sentences.chinese: 辛苦是一回事，教育孩子的觀念和做法又是另一回事。

sentences.english: You are that has enticed even time calling in Tokyo "the labor cane" the woman?
sentences.chinese: 誘惑了甚而時間叫在東京“辛苦藤莖”婦女的您是？

sentences.english: Old meade afraid daughter hard tom green leaves, m blue home, two people to replace.
sentences.chinese: 老米怕女兒辛苦讓米青留下，米藍回家，兩人替換。

sentences.english: Making money and accomplishing tasks is hard work, but well worth it.
sentences.chinese: 賺錢和圓夢都是辛苦活，但是值得這麼做。

sentences.english: Treatment can be painful and involves the gentle rewarming of the frostbitten body part.
sentences.chinese: 治療可能會很辛苦，需要使凍傷的部位逐漸回暖。

sentences.english: "Some lost their jobs and the remainder had to work harder, " said Mr. Pan.
sentences.chinese: 潘教授稱“有些人失業了，其他的必須更辛苦地工作。

sentences.english: Ribble said Louie wasn't just failing, he was suffering.
sentences.chinese: 裏勃說，路易不只是成績跟不上，而且深感學習辛苦。

sentences.english: Bill slaved away all weekend digging in the garden.
sentences.chinese: 比爾整個週末都在花園裏辛苦翻土。

sentences.english: I am allergic to sweat and hard work it’s so ‘1985′.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭流汗，討厭辛苦工作，還是和1985年一樣。

sentences.english: Working so hard for so little. it just isn't worth it.
sentences.chinese: 工作這麼辛苦卻領這麼少的錢，實在不值得。

sentences.english: To create waste is to waste our hard-earned money, and our savings.
sentences.chinese: 製造垃圾，就是在亂花自己辛苦掙來的金錢與存款。

sentences.english: I think we're just working a little bit too much these days.
sentences.chinese: 我想我們倆最近都工作得太辛苦了。

sentences.english: Having spent his youth inidleness, he is having to work in his old age.
sentences.chinese: 他年輕時不務正業，年老時非辛苦工作不可。

sentences.english: Consoling a colicky baby night after night is terribly hard.
sentences.chinese: 沒日沒夜的照顧小鬧騰非常的辛苦。

definition: to be industrious, rising early and going to bed late
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
see 起早貪黑|起早贪黑[qi3 zao3 tan1 hei1]
to tire oneself out through overwork/to work oneself to death
to pay/to invest (energy or time in a friendship etc)
to rush about/to be constantly on the move
